law.catch_line: Laser Equipment; Rules And Regulations; Penalties For Violation
law.text: The department may from time to time, after a public hearing, adopt, alter or repeal such rules and regulations relative to the use of laser systems, devices or equipment as it shall deem necessary to protect the public from the hazards of laser rays or beams, with penalties for the violation thereof not exceeding five hundred dollars for any particular offense. Such rules and regulations may require the registration of said systems, devices or equipment.[ Second paragraph effective until March 27, 2011. For text effective March 27, 2011, see below.] This section shall not be construed as limiting the powers of the department of labor and industry under the provisions of chapter one hundred and forty-nine relative to the prevention of accidents or injuries to employees.[ Second paragraph as amended by 2011, 3, Sec. 112 effective March 27, 2011. For text effective until March 27, 2011, see above.] This section shall not be construed as limiting the powers of the department of labor standards under the provisions of chapter one hundred and forty-nine relative to the prevention of accidents or injuries to employees.
